title: The Block's Mark slams foremen Keith and Dan during a tense clash
text:
The Block's Mark slammed foremen Keith and Dan on the show on Wednesday, after they suggested Mitch doesn't put enough effort in on site.

Keith and Dan went around the site to tell the teams about what areas they need to fix up as the competition comes to an end, which is when the confrontation took place.

'Mitch is going to have to put in,' Dan said, before Mark exploded.

'He works his guts out and I won't stand for it!' The Block's Mark (pictured) slammed foremen Keith and Dan during a tense clash on the show on Wednesday

'He always does, I'm really offended by that,' Mark said.

He added: 'He works his gutss out and I won't stand here and have anyone suggest he doesn't.'

'It's offensive, it's not right.'

Look out! 'Mitch is going to have to put in,' Dan (L, pictured R is Keith) said, before Mark exploded

Dan soon apologised and Keith remarked to camera: 'Oh mate, it was uncomfortable that was.'

Meanwhile, Mitch and Mark worked out a way to fix their budget problems and get back on track.

They also got rid of their blue tiles near there staircase, which the judges said they thought belonged on an oil rig.

Back in it to win it! Meanwhile on the show on Wednesday, Mitch and Mark worked out a way to fix their budget problems and get back on track

'We've had some really tough things thrown at us and we've all finished every week.

At the end of the episode, the teams all came together for a dinner party where they shared their best memories of their time on the show, as it's just over a week left until it ends.

Deb broke down in tears when she said how strong they've all been throughout the many challenges on the show.

'We've had our ups and downs, a few of them... I'll never forget working beside you all,' she said.

'It makes me emotional thinking about how tough it's been, but we've been tougher.'
description: The Block's Mark slammed foremen Keith and Dan on the show on Wednesday, after they suggested Mitch doesn't put enough effort in on site.
authors: Chloe-Lee Longhetti For Daily Mail Australia
